bug.author: bongbang
bug.description:
The parser raises a ValueError when used after a span in the doc has been merged. The message is either one of these two:
cannot resize this array: it does not own its data all the input array dimensions except for the concatenation axis must match exactly
<denchmark-h:h2>How to reproduce the behaviour</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>import spacy nlp = spacy.load('en_core_web_sm') parser = nlp.pipeline[1][1] assert isinstance(parser, spacy.pipeline.DependencyParser)
doc = nlp('Henry V is the best.', disable=['parser']) parser(doc) # works
doc = nlp('Henry V is the best.', disable=['parser']) doc[0:2].merge() parser(doc) # ValueError: all the input array dimensions except for the concatenation axis must match exactly </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
Operating System: Python Version Used: 3.6 spaCy Version Used: 2.0.18 Environment Information:

comments.comment: This should be fixed in v2.1. The bug was that we didn't resize the tensors during merge. If you install v2.1 you should find it fixed.
